intro: Astragalus chrysotrichus f. linearicus, commonly known as the linear-leaved milkvetch, is a botanical variant of the species Astragalus chrysotrichus. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. This plant is native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America, particularly in the western United States. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and disturbed areas. The plant is known for its ecological importance as a food source for various pollinators and livestock.
